cards.back: A measure of disorder or randomness in a system. Entropy always increases in isolated systems.

cards.front: What is First Law of Thermodynamics?
cards.back: Energy cannot be created or destroyed. The change in internal energy equals heat added minus work done.
cards.subject: Physics - Thermodynamics

cards.front: What is Second Law of Thermodynamics?
cards.back: Heat cannot spontaneously flow from a colder body to a hotter body. Entropy increases over time.
